body:
@ascarter `*` is very well defined as matching any sequence (including an empty sequence) of non-_separator_ characters. Thus `**` is equally well defined as matching zero or more non-separator characters, followed by a match of zero characters on the tail of the same filename.

The proposed special-casing of `**` will certainly not match less than it does now, but may match more, and the question is whether existing programs _could_ become broken through what constitutes a change in behavior.
